author: drkoepsell
title: Genomic Data Marketplace
description: Current markets for genomic data are centralized and run by the two major genetic testing companies. Ours is a democratic "de-sci" alternate

assessments.note: It is an interesting product that is based on a Blockchain. As it is very specialized, I doubt that it will increase the benefit and acceptance of cardano much.

I agree that this proposal addresses the challenge. The concept of De-Sci seems very attractive and with great potential for those who dont mind to get some return regarding their genomics data just like people gives/sells blood and/or sperm. Genomics and the industry that evolves around it its getting highly noticed, Cathie Woods from ArkInvest fund is an example of a strong supporter and investor in this field

I agree that the proposal for launching a Cardano-based version of the $DNA token, integrating with other Cardano based, decentralized scientific data sharing platforms relevant to genomic data, and further build-out a parallel Cadano-based version of the full Gene-Chain platform does effectively address the challenge - especially in terms of integrations.

Gene-Chain allows peer-to-peer, compensated and transparent transactions of genomic data where users are aware and rewarded directly.
The point here in this project is that they already have a solid project. And they even try this with anerc20 token.

This seems like a great use case for blockchains generally and would attract users to Cardano.  The proposal can be improved by presenting the markets for genomic data more detail and providing the estimation of ROI.

The project is already deployed on ERC_20 platform. The project is very beautiful but there is no clarity in the proposal about what these funds will be used for. It is certainly a nice initiative to have such an project associated to the platform but it needs more details about how funding will be used to release funding for such initiative.

It is not clear whether this project includes just creation of Cardano based token for payment or more.

Not much information regarding the experience, especially in regard of the implementation for cardano is provided. If you consider the current gas-prices and the funding, there is a big motivation to go through with the plan.

It would be interesting to know the level of adoption in ETH blockchain network from the dna data owners and the level of adoption from the researchers and consumers of the data.
The proposal lacks team experience, despite having a product running in ETH network. It would be nice to see some screenshots and the architecture of the Gene-Chain application.
I searched in google's play store and could find any app. Dont really know if its only available via web browser, this should be more clearer.

The fact that the team has previously launched the Gene-Chain using an erc20 token, $DNA in November 2018 is favourable in terms of experience. What I don't like about the proposal is the lack of a timetable, detailed plan, breakdown of the budget components. The proposal is asking for USD50,000 in funding, but with no further information about planned allocation. Big weakness in terms of - lack of plan details
They have already a company and an erc-20 token.I even read that a share of data of your gynome=20$ / company share.So yes it can work,i think its already working in other blockchains.
It operates on the Ethereum platform, so it is likely it will be implemented successfully.

Experience of implementing the project on other platform is demonstrated through successful implementation of project on other platform. There is no experience of native Cardano platform showcased.

There is no clarity in the plan and technology usage looking at the proposal.
As it works on the Etherium blockchain, it will very likely work on Cardano. But regarding the effectivness of solving the challenge, I have my doubts.

There should be concerns regarding legal issues mainly because we are dealing in a worldwide decentralized platform and I'm curious how this project deals with it in ETH blockchain network and the proposer didnt specify nor I cant find in their website.
It lacks roadmap and milestones and it the plan does not have details on how the budget will be applied in the project, since there is already a working solution

The proposal does not provide sufficient information to assess how feasible it is - it could be improved if fleshed out with more information on milestones, timetable, budgetary allocation, further information...

This information about genes and historical data for a patience can help a lot for new cures. Or to find why a disease is more often to this type of people e.t.c.
The major difference here is that other companies sell your data with out your concern. Here in this project your data is safe in the blockchain and if you want to sell them you get a reward in their token "DNA token".
There is no roadmap or milestones to specify step by step plan.  No detail information for how the fund to be spent, in that case not auditable.

The information provided is very little to consider feasibility of the project. Unless the proposal is clear for funding requested it makes no sense analyse the feasibility as deliverables are not very clear.

solution: Our Gene-Chain allows peer-to-peer, compensated and transparent transactions of genomic data where users are aware and rewarded directly.
experience: We launched the Gene-Chain using an erc20 token, $DNA in November 2018. We are now seeking to integrate with additional partners
